section.name: Using Maven
section.p: As we use Maven as our project build tool, you should have it installed when you want to build OpenEdge Modules from source. Learn more about Maven here

The downloaded install archive contains everything required to build OpenEdge Modules. The install archive has a single top-level directory named openedge-maverick-framework with all the project related files beneath that. You can now unpack the install archive.
The directory layout of OpenEdge Maverick Framework looks like this:
section.source: . |-- src | |-- java | |-- test | `-- etc |-- xdocs `-- target
section.p: The above layout conforms to the Maven standard directory layout, where src/java has the main sources, src/test has the unit tests and src/etc has additional sources and documents.

When you have Maven installed properly, you can use the usual commands with this project. You probably want to use maven jar as this builds the jar you need when you want to use this project. The jar will be placed in \target

section.name: Preparing your web application
section.p: Now that you build the jar, you should - besides including the jar in your project ;) - you have to prepare the rest of the web application. Look at ${projecthome}/src/example for an example to get you started. Note that the example is configured to be used with the two module implementations: usermanager-hib and mailjob from the openedge-modules-impl project.
